instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers On No post
threads.message: Hello. Got this board here and it was not turning on, shorted <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> line, which I traced to bad <CHIP>U7330</CHIP>, which I replaced. Board worked perfectly yesterday after the replacement of that chip, I turned off the machine and left it sitting on the bench to finish assembling today. Today, when I arrived at my workshop the machine was turning on but giving no POST. After some inspection I detected CPU VCORE was not present and I have now a full short on L7330/20/10. I thought maybe <CHIP>U7330</CHIP> was bad again and removed it, short persisted. So I removed <RESISTOR>R7330</RESISTOR>/20/10 to see on what side the short is, and for my bad luck, it's on CPU side. Tried injecting voltage, it sucks 5A from my bench PSU(maximum it can provide) but nothing gets even a little warm to touch. Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers On No post
threads.message:
Your PSU is in protection mode, doesn't inject voltage at all.
Just check with your voltmeter.

CPU is dead for sure.
I hope you removed the heatsink for test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Powers On No post
threads.message: Yes, heatsink removed of course... As I thought, dead CPU, just wanted a second opinion on that. Strange thing is it died after being fixed LOL. Strange.
